abstract: Disney is nearing a sale of Miramax to a group led by Ronald N. Tutor and Colony Capital for $600 million to $700 million, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.
snippet: Disney is nearing a sale of Miramax to a group led by Ronald N. Tutor and Colony Capital for $600 million to $700 million, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.
lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company is nearing a sale of its Miramax Films unit to an investor group led by construction executive Ronald N. Tutor and the private equity firm Colony Capital for $600 million to $700 million, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Wednesday.

headline.main: Disney Nears Sale of Miramax to Tutor and Colony

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The British production company that created the hit game show “Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” says Disney took advantage of its dual role of producing and distributing.
snippet: The British production company that created the hit game show “Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” says Disney took advantage of its dual role of producing and distributing.
lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company on Wednesday was ordered to pay almost $270 million in damages to Celador, the British production company that created the hit game show “Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” more than a decade ago.

headline.main: Disney Is Told to Pay $270 Million in ‘Millionaire’ Suit
headline.print_headline: Disney Is Told to Pay $270 Million in ‘Millionaire’ Suit

byline.original: By Brian Stelter and Brooks Barnes

abstract: The Walt Disney Company is nearing a sale of its Miramax Films unit to an investor group for $600 million to $700 million, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.
snippet: The Walt Disney Company is nearing a sale of its Miramax Films unit to an investor group for $600 million to $700 million, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company is nearing a sale of its Miramax Films unit to an investor group led by a construction executive, Ronald N. Tutor, and the private equity firm Colony Capital for $600 million to $700 million, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Disney Is Said to Be Nearing a Deal for Miramax Films
headline.print_headline: Disney Is Said to Be Nearing A Deal for Miramax Films

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The Walt Disney Company on Wednesday was ordered to pay almost $270 million in damages to Celador, the British production company that created the hit game show ”Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” more than a decade ago.
snippet: The Walt Disney Company on Wednesday was ordered to pay almost $270 million in damages to Celador, the British production company that created the hit game show ”Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” more than a decade ago.
lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company on Wednesday was ordered to pay almost $270 million in damages to Celador, the British production company that created the hit game show “Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” more than a decade ago.

headline.main: Disney Must Pay $270 Million in Battle Over ‘Millionaire’

abstract: This year at Sun Valley, the talk among the moguls has been less about the next big merger than about, at best, smaller deals — or strenuous denials that sales are in the offing.
snippet: This year at Sun Valley, the talk among the moguls has been less about the next big merger than about, at best, smaller deals — or strenuous denials that sales are in the offing.
lead_paragraph: 1:57 p.m. | Updated SUN VALLEY, Idaho — For years, the Allen & Company annual retreat here has been the birthplace of mega-deals that have reshaped the media landscape. Exhibit A: the sale of ABC to the Walt Disney Company. Exhibit B: the sale of a majority stake in NBC Universal to Comcast.

headline.main: Live From Sun Valley, Day Three

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
